required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study to Compare Kowa OCT Bi-μ and the Optovue iVue 100
clinical_study.official_title: Pilot Comparative Study of the Kowa OCT Bi-μ and the Optovue iVue 100

brief_summary.textblock: This study is a prospective comparative study to gather pilot agreement and precision data in normal subjects, subjects with glaucoma, and subjects with retinal disease.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Eligible participants assigned two interventions under random sequence assignments.

primary_outcome.measure: Compare KOWA OCT Bi-μ and Optovue iVue 100
primary_outcome.description: Full retinal thickness [Early Treatment Diabetic Retinopathy Study (ETDRS) Grid] Full retinal thickness (Manual Measurement) Retinal nerve fiber layer thickness Ganglion cell complex thickness Full retinal thickness map

secondary_outcome.measure: Safety: Evaluate any adverse events found during the clinical study
secondary_outcome.description: Evaluate any adverse events found during the clinical study

arm_group.description: Participants from three condition groups (normal, glaucoma, retinal disease) assigned two interventions (Kowa OCT Bi-μ and the Optovue iVue 100) under random sequence assignments.

intervention.description: Non-contact, ultra-high resolution ophthalmic imaging system for fundus imaging and axial cross-sectional and three-dimensional imaging of retinal structures.
U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) cleared and commercially available Optovue iVue 100
